title: [Large-Scale] Simulation Education Based on Design Expert Competency Model: Deepening Language Design Expertise (Focused on Text Structure, Vocabulary, and Expressive Effectiveness)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of design processes, experience in language structure analysis, foundational grammar and writing skills, along with experience using text analysis tools and understanding reading comprehension evaluation criteria
context.additional_context: Conducted in a large-scale language design practice environment using smartphone-based VR simulations, aiming to improve learners' reading comprehension, writing proficiency, and communication skills. Focuses on text optimization in digital environments and strengthening multimodal expression capabilities.

learning_goals: Apply the 5-stage design expertise model (Awareness-Analysis-Integration-Creation-Evaluation) to language design processes, explaining text structure, vocabulary selection, and expressive effectiveness through scientific analysis methods.
Perform ≥3 language structure optimization projects in VR simulations, implementing contextual coherence and reader-friendly design.

Learners provide evidence-based feedback on three peers’ language design works using a design expertise rubric, evaluating grammatical accuracy (≥80%), information efficiency (≥3/4 on a 4-point scale), and visual expressiveness (≥2/3 criteria). Feedback includes vocabulary diversity and syntactic complexity analysis.

resources: Mobile VR Headsets (15 units/group), Language Design Simulation Software, Competency Assessment Checklist
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
